Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish in places); above, possible traces of floral motif in added white, below, two faded white bands; below, possible traces of floral motif in white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of much of a hound running to right; added red patches on body and neck; part of spiked rosette, part of possible swastika and rising palmette with red on leaves and extending over the cul as filling ornament; below, on cul, guilloche.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the palmette, see British Museum 1924,1201.120.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 29, fig. 15, p. 256, no. 453, pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0517) (phase 2)
